intro: Joosia umbellifera var. occidentalis, commonly known as western umbrella-leaf, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many plants with umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-shaped clusters, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental and medicinal properties.
